results.title: The Five
results.creator_credit: Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and Joy Batchelor
results.brief_description: An animated health education film for school children designed to create a positive attitude in the minds of young girls aged 8-12 years. it seeks to encourage them to look after their feet, and emphasises the importance of wearing correctly fitted shoes. Animated by Harold Whitaker.

results.title: The Fitness factor
results.creator_credit: Tasmanian Film Corporation and John Honey
results.brief_description: An instructional film on the basic rules to physical fitness. Based on the book by Dr Russell Gibbs, LIFESTYLE FACTORS IN CORONARY HEART DISEASE.

results.title: The Fishermen of Quintay
results.brief_description: The Chilean Government’s decision that life in the isolated fishing villages must be improved brought two visitors - a Chilean Inspector of Fisheries and a UN Fisheries expert to the village of Quintay. The people of this community were anxious for progress, but they could do little to help due to poverty. The UN expert suggested that the fishermen form a co-operative for selling their fish and buying supplies. As a result life in this remote Chilean village has been raised to a new level.

results.title: The Fisherman and his wife
results.creator_credit: Minimal Produkten, Gisela Frisen and Per Ekholm
results.brief_description: This is the tale of a poor fisherman who catches an enchanted fish. His wife demands that he ask the fish to grant him a wish but the fish teaches the ambitious wife a lesson about wishing for too much. Puppets in silhouette are used to translate this Brothers Grimm fairytale.

results.title: The Fisherman's boy
results.brief_description: Explains some of the operations of a commercial fishing boat on a large lake. Tells how the captain’s small son learns to fish with a bobber from the dock before he is allowed to accompany his father on the boat.

results.title: The Fisher king
results.creator_credit: Tri-Star Pictures, Debra Hill, Lynda Obst and Terry Gilliam
results.brief_description: When a bigshot self-absorbed talkback radio host, Jack Lucas (Jeff Bridges), loses his job after a tragedy, he is plucked from disaster by the most improbable of saviours - a former history professor (Robin Williams), driven mad and onto the streets where he lives in a remarkable medieval world full of swords and sorcery, terrifying Red Knights and damsels in distress. This film serves grand lunacy and wisdom of the highest order with rare vision and style.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tri-Star Pictures, Debra Hill, Lynda Obst and Terry Gilliam

results.title: The Fish that nearly drowned
results.creator_credit: Moscow Educational Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A voice-over of aquarium scenes describing an Asian fish that can breathe air. Tells the story of various incidents that take place in the aquarium including the life habits of the fish showing how it builds its nest, and how an accident nearly causes its death.

results.title: The Fish run
results.creator_credit: Jack Flack, Merlin Films and Jack Howells
results.brief_description: The daily 300-mile run of heavy transport lorries carrying fish from Aberdeen to Manchester, filmed against an interesting scenic background. On the occasion recorded in the film, the run takes on an added interest as the lorries are testing a new fuel injector pump en route.
